metadata.Title: CVE-2014-6053 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The rfbProcessClientNormalMessage function in libvncserver/rfbserver.c inLibVNCServer 0.9.9 and earlier does not properly handle attempts to send alarge amount of ClientCutText data, which allows remote attackers to causea denial of service (memory consumption or daemon crash) via a craftedmessage that is processed by using a single unchecked malloc.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-6053` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncserver-config - 0.9.9+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libvncserver0 - 0.9.9+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
linuxvnc - 0.9.9+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

krfb - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

tightvncserver - 1.3.9-6.5+deb8u1build0.14.04.1~esm1
xtightvncviewer - 1.3.9-6.5+deb8u1build0.14.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.9+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1').
vino: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
krfb package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:4.13.3-0ubuntu1.1').
tightvnc package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.9-6.5+deb8u1build0.14.04.1~esm1').
italc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
